intro: Meibomia metallica, commonly known as the metallic meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
